patient_info: Syncope,Hepatic cysts,Ascites,Abnormal mitral valve morphology,Cardiomegaly,Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology,Abnormal aortic valve morphology,Tachycardia,Mitral regurgitation,Pericardial effusion,Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology,Right ventricular failure,Third degree atrioventricular block,Abnormal left ventricle morphology,Pleural effusion,Sleep disturbance,Episodic vomiting,Conjugated hyperbilirubinemia,Hypoalbuminemia,Elevated circulating creatine kinase concentration,Fatigable weakness,Exercise intolerance,Increased total bilirubin,Increased body weight,Poor appetite,Tricuspid regurgitation,Loss of consciousness,Abnormal ventricular septum morphology,Pedal edema,Decreased urine output,Regional left ventricular wall motion abnormality,Orthopnea,Left ventricular diastolic dysfunction,Right atrial enlargement,Increased circulating creatine kinase MB isoform
golden_diagnosis: Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 10,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia 12,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 9,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 8,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 11,Naxos disease/Naxos disease,Desminopathy/Myopathy, myofibrillar, 1,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 2,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 5,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 1,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 4,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 3,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 6,Desminopathy/Myopathy, myofibrillar, 1,致心律失常性右室发育不良/心肌病（ARVD/C）/Arrhythmogenic right ventriculardysplasia/ cardiomyopathy; ARVD/C,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 13
predict_diagnosis:
1. Cardiomyopathy, hypertrophic obstructive - This could explain the cardiomegaly, abnormal mitral and pulmonary valve morphology, and the symptoms of syncope and tachycardia.

2. Congenital heart disease, complex - The presence of abnormal valve morphology and right ventricular failure suggests a complex congenital heart condition.

3. Endocardial fibrosis - This rare condition can lead to valve fibrosis and regurgitation, explaining the mitral and tricuspid regurgitations.

4. Right heart failure - The symptoms of pedal edema, ascites, and pleural effusion point towards right heart failure, which could be due to various causes.

5. Cardiomyopathy, restrictive - The left ventricular diastolic dysfunction and increased total bilirubin could be indicative of a restrictive cardiomyopathy.

6. Liver disease, chronic - The presence of hepatic cysts, conjugated hyperbilirubinemia, and hypoalbuminemia suggests chronic liver disease.

7. Inborn error of metabolism - The episodic vomiting, poor appetite, and increased body weight could be manifestations of an inborn error of metabolism.

8. Myositis - The fatigable weakness and elevated creatine kinase concentration could be suggestive of a myositis.

9. Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (TTP) - The symptoms of syncope, hemolytic anemia (indicated by the increased total bilirubin), and thrombocytopenia (possible through elevated creatine kinase MB isoform) could point towards TTP.

10. Metabolic syndrome - The combination of cardiomyopathy, hepatic cysts, and symptoms like sleep disturbance and exercise intolerance could be suggestive of metabolic syndrome,尽管这通常不被认为是“罕见病”。

It is important to note that these are potential diagnoses and further investigation, including genetic testing, cardiological evaluation, and liver function tests, would be necessary to confirm any of these conditions.
